channel.title: Server ideas/concepts
channel.description:
^ Just as title says. I will be starting to work on something soon ( already purchased webhosting/a domain ) and I am currently trying to find unique ideas of what people as players want to see in an rsps and never see happen.
[hr]
I also wanted your thoughts on a non-gold economy. Everything would be bartering. How do we keep it fair to pkers? How would we get it started off?
[hr]
(Thanks to Vain_ for keeping this organized :D )

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:113, topic:547668”]Perks. Unlockable passive abilities which only apply in specific conditions.

e.g.:

Duelist; for every 3 stab or slash based attacks from any sword or longsword, the fourth hit will have a decreased attack delay.
Berserker; every crush based attack has a chance of stunning the enemy. The same enemy cannot be stunned again for 3 seconds.
Back-at-ya; while autocasting, you will instantly cast the last spell used against you against your target, for no additional cost of runes.
Metal fatigue; succesfull ranged attacks will decrease the target’s defence against the next ranged attack.[/quote]
I, in the past, have made tons of extensions to this idea too:

RuneScape's combat tends to be the same. Now we aren't looking to make a new EoC or anything, but we ARE looking to add some nice features.

If the player is using the slash combat style, the player has a chance to make the opponent bleed. If the player is using Ranged, the player has a chance to make an arrow stuck in the opponent’s skin. Also, if the player is using Ranged, and the combat style is accurate then they have a more accurate chance of getting the arrow stuck in the opponents skin. The victim, in turn, will try every turn of theirs to get the arrow out until they succeed doing so. Now, I will summarize every possibility.

Combat Type (Melee or Ranged) — Combat style (Stab, Accurate, Slash, etc.) — Effect — Percent chance for effect
Melee — Stab — The ability to make the opponents Attack decrease by 2 - 5. — 10%
Melee — Slash — The ability to make the opponent Bleed. — 5%
Melee — Crush — Crush the player. Inflicting 1/8 of their health. — 10%
Ranged — Make an arrow stuck on the victim. — 5%
Effect — Remedies
Bleed — Put a bandage on.
Having an arrow stuck on you — Wear Magic Secateurs or wait for the effect to go away. Your player has a 70% chance of taking the arrow out themseves. However, if he does, it will hurt your player considerable damage.
Having a stat drained — Drink a restore potion.
Having yourself get crushed — Wearing something that neutralizes crush effect (chainbodies, or a sq shield, or defenders).


From: [474]World 901 - Your soon to be destiny, just steps away… - The Last Destiny.

[quote=“arham 4, post:1, topic:519818”][center][size=24pt]A Ranking System[/size]
[size=14pt]Inspired by Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2[/size][/center]

Features:

[ul][li]Pk Points[/li]
[li]Killstreaks[/li]
[list]
[li]Most killed record[/li]
[/list]
[li]Experience[/li]
[li]Rank names[/li]
[li]Bonuses by killstreak[/li]
[li]No use of process[/li][/ul]

[/quote]

[hr]

BUMP TO THIS GENIUS TOPIC

Read full topic

Perks. Unlockable passive abilities which only apply in specific conditions.

e.g.:

Duelist; for every 3 stab or slash based attacks from any sword or longsword, the fourth hit will have a decreased attack delay.
Berserker; every crush based attack has a chance of stunning the enemy. The same enemy cannot be stunned again for 3 seconds.
Back-at-ya; while autocasting, you will instantly cast the last spell used against you against your target, for no additional cost of runes.
Metal fatigue; succesfull ranged attacks will decrease the target’s defence against the next ranged attack.

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Project_Territh Project Territh
item.description:
@Project_Territh wrote:

I’ve been trying to implement several things into my server, as I am still a newbie in Java it’s challenging. If you want to take a look at some of my ideas in action head over to
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,125.0.html

Anyway, here are some ideas I have.

-Good karma bad karma system, can be seen at work in my server above.
-Capturing players for bounties and getting a cash reward for it.
-Discoverable locations, once you find a location on the map you gain access to it by fast travel.
-NPC followers that you can give commands to, similar to summoning.
-Each city depending on your karma is neutral, enemy, ally. Those who are ally you can trade with and barter, those who are neutral you can visit but not trade, those who are enemy will attack you once you are close.
-Perks that increase a player of having a special dialogue option.
-Some dialogue options require a certain level of speech.
-Repair and make own equipment with a certain smithing level.
-Custom quest that are lengthy and rewarding.

An example of perks within the karma system…

http://gyazo.com/650a0305c5b440cb1b869037ae8fa09b

Bounties

Custom titles

I’ll add more later.

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:106, topic:547668”]Kind of relevant, someone on rune-serber was talking about a bot class that behaved similar to a player (just randomized inputs) and this sounds similar to what you’re talking about.

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/show-off/561994-serversided-bots.html

However, I do like the idea of just casual NPC encounters, because it adds a life to the server.[/quote]
I did that once. In World 901, I made a minigame that literally made a new player and he could talk and everything.

Player host = new Player(new PlayerDetails(null, "Host", "world901", null, null));

[code=java]
package org.rs2server.rs2.event.impl;

import org.rs2server.rs2.event.Event;
import org.rs2server.rs2.model.*;
import org.rs2server.rs2.model.minigame.impl.World901;
import org.rs2server.rs2.net.ActionSender;
import org.rs2server.rs2.util.Misc;

/**

  • Created with IntelliJ IDEA.

  • User: Arham 4

  • Date: 9/17/13

  • Time: 8:26 PM

  • Purpose: To show the ‘Host’ of the World 901 Minigame.
    */
    public class HostMinigameEvent extends Event {

    /**

    • Creates an event with the specified delay.
    • @param delay The delay.
      */
      public HostMinigameEvent(long delay) {
      super(delay);
      }

    int timer = 0;
    Player host = new Player(new PlayerDetails(null, “Host”, “world901”, null, null));

    /**

    • The execute method is called when the event is run. The general contract
    • of the execute method is that it may take any action whatsoever.
      */
      @Override
      public void execute() {
      if (timer == 0) {
      host.setTeleportTarget(Location.create(2120, 4914, 0));
      host.face(Location.create(host.getLocation().getX() + 1, host.getLocation().getY(), host.getLocation().getZ()));
      World.getWorld().register(host);
      host.forceChat(“Welcome”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().turnCameraToLocation(Location.create(2120, 4914, 0), 2);
      player.getActionSender().moveCameraToLocation(Location.create(2125, 4915, 0), 1000, 0, 10);
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “Welcome”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 2) {
      host.forceChat(“to World 901.”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “to World 901.”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 7) {
      host.forceChat(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() + " of the world’s greatest rulebreakers in the game");
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().turnCameraToLocation(Location.create(2132, 4923, 0), 2);
      player.getActionSender().moveCameraToLocation(Location.create(2132, 4923, 0), 1000, 0, 10);
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() + " of the world’s greatest rulebreakers in the game");
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 16) {
      host.forceChat(“have been put into this Draynor Village”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “have been put into this Draynor Village”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 23) {
      host.forceChat(“in order to prove who is the best player.”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “in order to prove who is the best player.”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 32) {
      host.forceChat(“Only one of you will leave this place with a grand prize”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().turnCameraToLocation(Location.create(2149, 4916, 0), 2);
      player.getActionSender().moveCameraToLocation(Location.create(2149, 4916, 0), 1000, 0, 5);
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “Only one of you will leave this place with a grand prize”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 38) {
      host.forceChat(“The winner will get more money and pride”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “The winner will get more money and pride”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 45) {
      host.forceChat(“and of course some extra, true rewards.”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().turnCameraToLocation(Location.create(2120, 4914, 0), 2);
      player.getActionSender().moveCameraToLocation(Location.create(2125, 4915, 0), 3250, 1, 5);
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_1, “and of course some extra, true rewards.”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 53) {
      host.forceChat(“I wish you all good luck…”);
      for (Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.CALM_2, “I wish you all good luck…”);
      }
      host.face(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().get(Misc.random(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer().size() - 1)).getLocation());
      }
      if (timer == 58) {
      for (final Player player : World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPlayer()) {
      player.getActionSender().removeAllInterfaces();
      player.setTeleportTarget(World.getWorld().getWorld901().getPseudoRandomLocation());
      player.getActionSender().stopCinematics();
      player.getActionSender().playSound(Sound.create(3302, (byte) 1, 0));
      player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(host.getName(), ActionSender.DialogueType.PLAYER, -1, Animation.FacialAnimation.DISTRESSED, “FIGHT!”);
      player.getCombatState().setCanMove(true);
      World.getWorld().submit(new Event(100000) {
      @Override
      public void execute() {
      if (player.getMinigame() == null || !World.getWorld().getWorld901().gameStarted) {
      this.stop();
      }
      player.incrementWorld901Duration(1);
      if (player.getMinigame() == null || !World.getWorld().getWorld901().gameStarted) {
      this.stop();
      }
      }
      });
      }
      World901.canAttack = true;
      World.getWorld().unregister(host);
      this.stop();
      }
      if (timer >= 0) {
      timer++;
      }
      }
      }[/code]

Lol

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You guys are taking what Grand Theft Auto has been doing and are putting it in a server.

Not saying it’s bad. I’m just saying.

Example:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=krvSnHfOOVM

GTA 5 NPCs basically live their own lives, separate from what you’re doing. So you could literally follow one as it went to the store, to eat, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:100, topic:547668”]^ I like that actually very realistic.

It kind of gives me a really cool idea. Why can’t cities have an interactive map of when a certain npc does a certain action every second/minute. Like you could set it so an npc stays in his home from 11pm to 8am. Gets up, goes to the bank, goes down the ladder and starts mining. Etc.[/quote]
Thats my goal tbh at one point. Making the entire world interactive. That’s why I made [quote=“arham 4, post:94, topic:547668”]FroyoScape’s Event Guy Idea[/quote]

Like seriously. People should utilize these NPCs in major cities. Town crier? How many servers besides mine have actually bothered to use those?

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:1, topic:547668”]How do we keep it fair to pkers?[/quote]What? Random pvp drops is how you keep it fair to pkers. Add skilling supplies (i.e. Noted magic logs, or raw monkfish, etc., depending on your economy), and other nonessential items for pking to. Or simply, a pvp store. “But pvp stores are where you get gear for pking!” Make a second one. Don’t call it a “PVP Store”, call it, “PK Point Supply Depot”, where you can buy miscellaneous goods.

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:100, topic:547668”]^ I like that actually very realistic.

It kind of gives me a really cool idea. Why can’t cities have an interactive map of when a certain npc does a certain action every second/minute. Like you could set it so an npc stays in his home from 11pm to 8am. Gets up, goes to the bank, goes down the ladder and starts mining. Etc.[/quote]
So basically a city worth of Max’s? I could stand that.

I also love the idea of more NPC vs NPC battles occuring. Khazard vs Gnomes is cool, but I would love to see more sporadic events occuring. Like maybe a random wizard could spawn and as he walks by a goblin area the goblins would notice him and begin banding together to fight him.

EDIT: For higher revisions, I would love to see Runespan become the norm for rune collection. Just up the amount of runes obtained per successful siphon.

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20140605055714/runescape/images/8/88/Rs_map_31_jan_12.png

Obviously you have already stated that the idea was not fully developed, but just looking at the 2012 RS map there are tons of homes in each of the cities that could be filled with players. Owners could really do a ton of player interaction with this as well by allowing players to pay their taxes to their local king, duke, or even just having a local tax collector NPC in the middle of the area. That money could then be used to pay for “upgrades” to the town, such as having an anvil placed next to their town’s furnace, slayer masters being paid to come to the town, slayer masters “breeding” different species of monsters close to the town for the locals to farm for needed supplies, and even if necessary a bank could be bought and a banker could be recruited to man the bank.

This, to me, would be an excellent way to take tons of money out of the game (and it really should cost a lot), build community, build an economy around property value (Since homes in towns with more amenities will be more appealing than those without), and make the game all around more fun because you will see the world evolving. Plus you could use forum integration and create town sections that you can hold polls in to allow players to vote on what they want their next upgrade to be and how much it will cost.

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

There isn’t much at this time I can really throw at you as far as details… but I wanted to see how other developers picture a system such as this…

I can’t say I have seen many servers ( maybe one? ) with a mount system. The mount system like most mmo’s would allow you to sit on top of something while being moved from point a to point b.

The only thing I can think of remotely similar are the magic carpets from rainbowscape.

Thoughts/opinions?

Read full topic

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Yeah I can personally say I wouldn’t play on a tasked based server, especially if I had to get a new task every 5 to 10 minutes. I would want to do what I want when I want without repercussions. Maybe I am misunderstanding the concept but what what I gather it sounds great for server owners, horrible for players.

The idea of a pure battering economy sounds meh, but what I would like to see is maybe no gold being dropped into the world by monsters, but rather players can choose to mint gold pieces through processing gold bars and turning them into gold pieces. Maybe each gold bar could create 5-10 pieces (randomly) and that would allow players to choose what type of economy they want, if they want gold to hold weight or not. I would also probably remove the ability to cast alchemy spells.

item.title: Server ideas/concepts
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:89, topic:547668”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=666574.msg4456823#msg4456823 date=1415369776]

I also wanted your thoughts on a non-gold economy. Everything would be bartering. How do we keep it fair to pkers? How would we get it started off?
[/quote]think minecraft villagers. make certain npcs request items and the players have to collect those items and trade them for higher tier items etc. add timers to it, so the faster they collect them the more items they get in return - or even granted experience.

have the system check for stats, somewhat like dungeoneering does. for the most part the items should be obtainable but you want some hard “tasks” such as if the players mining is only 49, request mithril or adamant etc.

players can’t skip the tasks so they either need to find someone with the stats and barter for the items needed, or they need to train themselves.

You know, I’m pretty sure something like this could stop botting. Let’s say you get 1x experience and a time penalty when you do the training in a monotonous fashion (perhaps you’ll only string one bow in the time you would usually expect to string 5 or 10 bows).
In contrast, you take your idea and set it up so that the player gets both a generous bonus helping of the items and a generous amount of experience. They don’t get to keep the specific items that they obtained - they get something equivalent or better (and they get more of it).
So maybe they are tasked with cutting an inventory of yew logs. In return they get experience equivalent to 5x the normal rate AND they actually receive three times as many blood runes or twice as many magic logs or whatever.

The catch is that you make it so they have to get a new task every 5 to 10 minutes, and you make it so that task requires a captcha to obtain.[/quote]

The KaramjaPK server is task based and has this exact implementation. In fact, players won’t even get drops if they don’t have a task but they will gain reduced exp.
